intro: Mollinedia chrysophylla, commonly known as the golden-leaved mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its striking golden-yellow leaves, which are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters during the spring. Mollinedia chrysophylla is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
